4.2   Payment

IBM invoices will specify the amount due. Payment is due upon receipt and payable as specified in such invoice. Customer agrees to pay accordingly, including any late payment fees. Payment will be made in United States dollars.
perturbation.changed_text:
4.2   Payment

IBM invoices will specify the amount due. Payment is due upon receipt and payable as specified in such invoice. Customer agrees to pay accordingly, including any late payment fees. Payment will be made in United States dollars. Notwithstanding the above, for all invoices exceeding $100,000, payment shall be due 60 days from the date of invoice receipt.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction regarding the payment deadline. The original clause states payment is due upon receipt, while the modified clause introduces a 60-day payment window for larger invoices. This creates ambiguity and uncertainty regarding when payment is actually due, especially for invoices over $100,000, potentially leading to disputes over late payment fees.

perturbation.original_text:
3.3   Termination for Cause

Customer or IBM may terminate this Agreement for material breach of this Agreement by the other upon written notice containing the specific nature and dates of the material breach. The breaching party will have thirty (30) days from receipt of notice to cure such breach, except for nonpayment by Customer, which must be cured within seven (7) business days from receipt of notice. If such breach has not been timely cured, then the non-breaching party may immediately terminate this Agreement upon written notice; provided, however, it is understood that in the event IBM has so breached this Agreement IBM shall not be entitled to recover the early termination charges described in Section 3.4(b) below.
perturbation.changed_text:
3.3   Termination for Cause

Customer or IBM may terminate this Agreement for material breach of this Agreement by the other upon written notice containing the specific nature and dates of the material breach. The breaching party will have thirty (30) days from receipt of notice to cure such breach, except for nonpayment by Customer, which must be cured within seven (7) business days from receipt of notice. If such breach has not been timely cured, then the non-breaching party may immediately terminate this Agreement upon written notice; provided, however, that any termination by IBM due to Customer's breach requires a 60-day written notice period before termination is effective.
perturbation.explanation: The original text provides a 7-day cure period for non-payment and allows immediate termination after that period. The modified text introduces a 60-day written notice requirement before IBM can terminate for Customer's breach. This creates a direct contradiction regarding the termination process and the timeline involved, particularly in cases of non-payment, leading to confusion and potential disputes regarding the enforceability of the termination clause.

13.1  Services

IBM, in its reasonable discretion, may change the terms and conditions of Attachment A and/or Service Option Attachments, upon at least ninety (90) days prior notice to Customer. IBM may change the prices of Service Option Attachments after twelve (12) months following the applicable Service Option Attachment Start Date upon at least ninety (90) days prior written notice to Customer. Any such changes will not apply retroactively. If Customer disagrees with any such changes, Customer may in its sole discretion terminate this Agreement (or some or all of the affected Service Option Attachments) without the payment of termination charges upon notice to IBM at least thirty (30) days prior to the effective date of the applicable change.
perturbation.changed_text:
13.1  Services

IBM, in its reasonable discretion, may change the terms and conditions of Attachment A and/or Service Option Attachments, upon at least ninety (90) days prior notice to Customer. IBM may change the prices of Service Option Attachments after twelve (12) months following the applicable Service Option Attachment Start Date upon at least ninety (90) days prior written notice to Customer. Any such changes will not apply retroactively. If Customer disagrees with any such changes, Customer may in its sole discretion terminate this Agreement (or some or all of the affected Service Option Attachments) without the payment of termination charges; however, such termination must be exercised within 15 days of IBM's notice of change to avoid any early termination penalties.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause allows the customer to terminate the agreement (or affected attachments) due to changes imposed by IBM, as long as the termination notice is given 30 days prior to the effective date of the change. However, the modified text introduces a constraint stating that the termination option must be exercised within 15 days of IBM's notice of change to avoid early termination penalties. This creates a contradiction because the original language seems to give the customer a window that lasts until 30 days before the effective date of changes, while the modified language significantly reduces that window to 15 days of the change notice, putting customer's at risk for early termination fees.
